Ages & Nights Mondays: 18+ Wednesdays: 28+ Location Fairbank Community Center — Community Center Gym Fees $47 Residents • $52 Non-Residents (per 6-week session) Session Cycle This program runs in repeating 6-week sessions from fall through June . Start and end dates for each cycle are posted on MyRec at registration time. Any holidays, elections, or facility conflicts will be managed with make-up nights to ensure a full six weeks of play. About the Program Weekly pick-up games in a friendly, supervised environment. Show up, make teams, and play. Games organized on-site; emphasis on fun, fitness, and sportsmanship. Indoor sneakers required; bring water. Please follow all facility rules and staff directions. Pre-registration is strongly recommended. Walk-ins ONLY permitted if program is not at capacity. Currently Monday nights has openings. Walk-ins are only permitted for Monday. Each class emphasizes safe range conduct, proper form, and steady skill progression—great for brand-new archers and returners. Program Snapshot Who: Ages 9–Adult (no prior experience required) Schedule: Fridays, 6:15–7:15 PM (various date ranges shown below) Coaches: USA Archery–certified instructors Equipment: All gear provided (recurve bows, arrows, arm guards) Format: Progressive lessons, safety briefings, guided target practice, and weekly challenges Session Length: Typically 5 weeks (see dates below) Skills & Benefits Fundamentals: stance, grip, anchor, aim, release, follow-through Consistent form and shot grouping to build accuracy and confidence Focus, patience, and body control in a supportive environment Creative archery games and mini-competitions for all levels Safety on the Range Strict range commands; arrows retrieved only on the coach’s signal Clear shooting lanes, coach-to-participant oversight, and fitted equipment Positive, technique-first coaching for all ages and abilities What to Bring / Wear Closed-toe athletic shoes Comfortable, fitted clothing (avoid loose sleeves/hood strings); About the Program A supervised, fun pick-up environment—no league pressure or formal coaching. Games are organized on-site each week with one coach/referee per court. No official scoring; focus on play, hustle, and sportsmanship. Participants must follow gym rules and demonstrate good behavior. Disruptive behavior may result in removal without return. Curtis Middle School Transportation to FCC Make arrival easy. This transportation option brings students from Curtis Middle School directly to the Fairbank Community Center for a prompt 3:30 PM start. Pick-Up: Curtis dismissal (~3:10 PM) Drop-Off: Fairbank Community Center (~3:25 PM) Fee & Seats: $3 per registered day — book by the day; max 12 seats (may add a second trip if demand is high) Important: Register for the correct day(s)/dates to match your program attendance. Limited seats; no walk-ins. Register for Curtis Middle School Transportation Optional Add-On: Dinner & Game Room Hang-Out with Coach Aquino Fridays, 5:30 PM – 7:30 PM • $20 per night • Runs with a minimum of 4 participants Rotating dinner themes (Burrito Night, Chick-fil-A Night, Custom Sub Night, and more). The full dinner schedule will be posted soon. Game Room Features: Air Hockey Table Foosball Tables Hoop Shoot Bumper Pool Lego Zone Dinner & Hang Registration — see add-on to purchase Pre-registration required. No walk-ins. Pick-Up: Curtis dismissal (~3:10 PM) Drop-Off: Fairbank Community Center (~3:25 PM) Fee & Seats: $3 per registered day — book by the day; max 12 seats (may add a second trip if demand is high) Important: Register for the correct day(s)/dates to match your program attendance. Limited seats; no walk-ins. Register for Curtis Middle School Transportation Optional Add-On: Dinner & Game Room Hang-Out with Coach Aquino Fridays, 5:30 PM – 7:30 PM • $20 per night • Runs with a minimum of 4 participants Rotating dinner themes (Burrito Night, Chick-fil-A Night, Custom Sub Night, and more). The full dinner schedule will be posted soon. Game Room Features: Air Hockey Table Foosball Tables Hoop Shoot Bumper Pool Lego Zone Dinner & Hang Registration — see add-on to purchase Pre-registration required. No walk-ins.

Sudbury Park and Recreation Register Programs Search Activities Memberships Facilities Facility List Calendar General Info News Dept Info Meetings Gallery Team Info Contact Contact Us Help How to Register Affiliates Municipal Site Account Login Create Account Account Login Create Account Register Programs Search Activities Memberships Facilities Facility List Calendar General Info News Dept Info Meetings Gallery Team Info Contact Contact Us Help How to Register Affiliates Municipal Site Register Now Skip to nav Pickleball Membership Program • Register • View Cart • NO NEW MEMBERSHIPS AT THIS TIME - PLEASE JOIN WAIT-LIST (IF DAILY NUMBERS CALM-DOWN, WE WILL RE-OPEN) Pickleball Membership Program 2025–2026 Season Program Description Please read through the full information below to understand how memberships work, registration details, and seasonal guidelines. Season Dates: Tuesday, September 23, 2025 – Friday, April 17, 2026 Days: Monday, Tuesday, Thursday, Friday (No membership play on Wednesdays) Hours: 6:00 AM – 3:30 PM Location: Fairbank Community Center Gymnasium Eligibility: Adults age 18+ Note: Beginners are encouraged to take a clinic and have prior experience before participating in open play. Important: Schedule may be adjusted due to holidays, weather, elections, or building maintenance. Dates will be posted as they are confirmed. Membership Types & Pricing Choose from a full season or a monthly membership. Sudbury Resident: $300 Full Season / $48 Monthly Sudbury Resident 60+: $270 Full Season / $43 Monthly Price adjustment will happen at check-out automatically by age (60yo+). It won't display until you are checking out! Non-Resident: $350 Full Season / $55 Monthly Non-Resident 60+: $320 Full Season / $50 Monthly No drop-ins or day passes. Program Reminders No play on holidays, Town-observed holidays, or posted blackout dates No play on Wednesdays (we have Private Court Reservations & Clinics) Must scan in using your membership card at the front desk Round Robin rotation system and Code of Conduct posted in the gym & click here to read Round Robin/Conduct Code Clean court sneakers ONLY! We can all do our part in helping keep the courts clean and safe for all. No wet & salty sneakers! SENIOR DISCOUNT WILL BE APPLIED AT CHECK-OUT AUTOMATICALLY BY AGE! Refund Policy Refund requests must be made using our Refund Request Form, found on our website, and dated at least 7 business days prior to the start of the program. Refund request made at least 7 business days in advance of the program will be assessed a $10 withdrawal fee.  After 7 business days, no refunds will be granted. Refunds are easier to process if you pay by credit card. If more than three months have passed since your original credit card transaction your refund will be proceed by check. If you paid by check, you must submit a refund form with a copy of the cancelled check. Senior Discount SENIOR DISCOUNT WILL BE APPLIED AT CHECK-OUT AUTOMATICALLY BY AGE! This option is a one-time payment that secures your spot for the entire indoor season. We will reduce the full season fee slightly each month as the season progresses.

Monthly Recurring Membership:
This flexible plan is designed for those who prefer not to commit to the full season. It automatically renews each month unless you cancel. Starts on the day you register. 

Please note:
If you cancel a monthly plan, we cannot guarantee space will be available should you wish to rejoin later.

Non-residents are welcome to register beginning September 15, only if space permits. We won’t know availability for non-residents until resident registration has closed. Sudbury Park and Recreation Register Programs Search Activities Memberships Facilities Facility List Calendar General Info News Dept Info Meetings Gallery Team Info Contact Contact Us Help How to Register Affiliates Municipal Site Account Login Create Account Account Login Create Account Register Programs Search Activities Memberships Facilities Facility List Calendar General Info News Dept Info Meetings Gallery Team Info Contact Contact Us Help How to Register Affiliates Municipal Site Register Now Skip to nav Pickleball Sessions Program (2-Hour/6-Week) • Register • View Cart • Pickleball Programs – Fall 2025 Organized, indoor rotating play in a welcoming environment. Choose Thursday evenings (Intermediate+) or Saturday sessions (Intermediate+ and Beginner+). Structured open play, fair rotations, and a great run for all. Program Snapshot Where: Fairbank Community Center – Community Center Gym (40 Fairbank Rd, Sudbury, MA) Format: Round-robin rotation (self-managed with on-site guidance) Session Length: 6 weeks (fall blocks typically run 5–6 weeks) Capacity: Max 21 players per time slot Thursday Night Pickleball Day/Time: Thursdays, 6:00 PM – 8:00 PM Skill Level: Intermediate+ (you know the rules, have some experience, and play occasionally) Max Participants: 21 Format: Round-robin rotation; keep matches moving and rotate promptly Saturday Morning Pickleball Session 1: 9:00 AM – 11:00 AM — Intermediate+ Session 2: 11:15 AM – 1:15 PM — Open Level Max Participants (each session): 21 Format: Round-robin rotation; fair, quick court changes How Rotations Work Check in at the front desk on the digital pad before stepping on court. Note: Scanning is not available. Place your paddle in the queue and join the next available court. Play to a standard game (or timed games if crowded), then rotate per the posted instructions. Winners split; new partners each round to keep play balanced and social. What to Bring Indoor court shoes (non-marking soles required) Pickleball paddle (loaners limited) Water bottle Good attitude and willingness to rotate Notes & Policies These are self-managed open play sessions; participants are expected to rotate fairly. Schedule may adjust due to elections, building maintenance, or facility needs; any changes will be communicated. Program Snapshot Where: Fairbank Community Center – Community Center Gym (40 Fairbank Rd, Sudbury, MA) Format: Round-robin rotation (self-managed with on-site guidance) Session Length: 6 weeks (fall blocks typically run 5–6 weeks) Capacity: Max 21 players per time slot Thursday Night Pickleball Day/Time: Thursdays, 6:00 PM – 8:00 PM Skill Level: Intermediate+ (you know the rules, have some experience, and play occasionally) Max Participants: 21 Format: Round-robin rotation; keep matches moving and rotate promptly Saturday Morning Pickleball Session 1: 9:00 AM – 11:00 AM — Intermediate+ Session 2: 11:15 AM – 1:15 PM — Open Level Max Participants (each session): 21 Format: Round-robin rotation; fair, quick court changes How Rotations Work Check in at the front desk on the digital pad before stepping on court. Note: Scanning is not available. Place your paddle in the queue and join the next available court. Play to a standard game (or timed games if crowded), then rotate per the posted instructions. Winners split; new partners each round to keep play balanced and social. What to Bring Indoor court shoes (non-marking soles required) Pickleball paddle (loaners limited) Water bottle Good attitude and willingness to rotate Notes & Policies These are self-managed open play sessions; participants are expected to rotate fairly. Schedule may adjust due to elections, building maintenance, or facility needs; any changes will be communicated. Sudbury Park and Recreation Register Programs Search Activities Memberships Facilities Facility List Calendar General Info News Dept Info Meetings Gallery Team Info Contact Contact Us Help How to Register Affiliates Municipal Site Account Login Create Account Account Login Create Account Register Programs Search Activities Memberships Facilities Facility List Calendar General Info News Dept Info Meetings Gallery Team Info Contact Contact Us Help How to Register Affiliates Municipal Site Register Now Skip to nav Pickleball Private Court Reservations - 1.5's • Register • View Cart • Pickleball Private Court Rentals Fairbank Community Center • Community Center Gym (Indoor Courts) Enjoy your own private pickleball court with family or friends. One person registers for the whole group (up to 6 players ), and you’ll have a dedicated court for your entire reservation — an easy way to play with your own group without open-play rotations. Quick Facts Fees $25 Resident • $35 Non-Resident Pickleball Program Members: 25% off Group Size Up to 6 players per court One registrant reserves on behalf of the entire group. What’s Included One (1) court + one (1) net Bring your own paddles and balls. Location & Check-In Fairbank Community Center — Community Center Gym Please check in at the front desk before entering the gym. Available Time Blocks 6:00–7:30 AM 7:30–9:00 AM small gap for pre-k soccer 9:30–11:00 AM If a time shows Full , it isn’t available. You can select as many future dates as you’d like — please double-check the exact date(s) before completing checkout. How It Works 1) One Person Registers Reserve a single court for your group (max 6 players). The registrant pays the full session fee; no additional checkouts needed for guests. 2) Arrive & Check In Head to the Parks & Rec desk to check in. Staff will confirm your reservation and court assignment. 3) Play Your Session Enjoy your private court for the full reserved time with no rotations . Play only with your group, and please finish on time so the next group can begin promptly. Notes & Policies Member Discount 25% off for current Sudbury Rec Pickleball Program members. Log into your MyRec account; eligible discounts apply at checkout. You won’t see the discount until checkout. Footwear & Equipment Clean, non-marking indoor shoes required. Bring your own paddles and balls (net provided). Water only in the gym; no food permitted. Use Guidelines Private recreational use only; no paid instruction or subletting. Max 6 players per court. Please respect staff directions and posted gym rules. Scheduling Available dates/times are posted online. If a slot shows Full , it’s not available. You may select multiple future dates in one checkout — please double-check the date(s) you’ve selected before paying. Cancellations: account credit may be issued; cancellations made at least 7 business days in advance are eligible per policy. Questions? Contact Sudbury Parks & Recreation at recreation@sudbury.ma.us or 978-443-1092. Links: cancelations and refund policy How to register for programs, click here to review the video. Sudbury Park and Recreation Register Programs Search Activities Memberships Facilities Facility List Calendar General Info News Dept Info Meetings Gallery Team Info Contact Contact Us Help How to Register Affiliates Municipal Site Account Login Create Account Account Login Create Account Register Programs Search Activities Memberships Facilities Facility List Calendar General Info News Dept Info Meetings Gallery Team Info Contact Contact Us Help How to Register Affiliates Municipal Site Register Now Skip to nav Marcus Lewis Pickleball Coaching • Register • View Cart • Marcus Lewis Pickleball Coaching Program Fairbank Community Center • Community Center Gym (Court #3) Progressive, high-quality instruction for adult players. Sessions are grouped by ability, so everyone learns at the right pace in a supportive environment. Use the level guide below to choose your best fit, then select a registration option at the bottom (dates/times/fees are listed in the registration lines). Note: Schedule may adjust due to weather, elections, or building maintenance. Loaner paddles and balls are available. Introductory Pickleball Coaching (Beginner) Brand-new players or those returning after a long break. Learn rules, court layout, scoring, safe movement, grip/stance, and core strokes (serve, return, forehand, backhand). Simple progressions with lots of guided reps in a welcoming setting. Outcome: Comfort with basics and readiness for friendly open play. 2.5 Advanced-Beginner Pickleball Coaching You know the fundamentals and want consistency. Build reliable serve/return, cleaner contact, footwork and positioning, and controlled dinks. Intro to third-shot options and simple doubles communication and rotation. Outcome: Longer rallies and confident participation in social doubles. 3.0 Low-Intermediate Pickleball Coaching Solidify patterns and shot selection. Emphasis on third-shot drop vs. drive, transition footwork to the kitchen, sustained dinking, soft resets, and opportunistic attacking. Scenario-based points with feedback on court coverage and teamwork. Outcome: Execute core patterns reliably and convert more points at the kitchen. 3.5 Intermediate Pickleball Coaching For experienced players aiming to sharpen tactics. Pace control, resets from the mid-court, targeted third shots, reading and countering speed-ups, baiting, stacking/switching, and smarter positioning. High-rep drill blocks plus coached, situational play. Outcome: Higher conversion in fast exchanges and league/tournament play. Drills Pickleball Coaching (All Level) Fast-paced stations to maximize touches: ball-fed sequences, serve/return ladders, third-shot repetitions, transition volleys, hand-speed games, and short coached play. Great add-on for any level to build mechanics and conditioning. Outcome: Sharper mechanics, better stamina, and skills that carry into match play. Coached Round Robin Play (3-Week Session) A fun hybrid of play and instruction! Players rotate through matches while receiving live, on-court coaching. Coaches offer in-game feedback on positioning, shot selection, and tactics during real-time play. Perfect for those ready to test their skills under expert guidance. Outcome: Improved court awareness, smarter decision-making, and confidence in match situations. Who: Adults 17+  • Where: Fairbank Community Center Gym (Side B / Court #3)  • How to Register: Choose your level above, then select your preferred session from the registration options below (dates/times/fees are shown in the registration lines). Marcus Lewis Pickleball Coaching • Register • View Cart • Marcus Lewis Pickleball Coaching Program Fairbank Community Center • Community Center Gym (Court #3) Progressive, high-quality instruction for adult players. Sessions are grouped by ability, so everyone learns at the right pace in a supportive environment. Use the level guide below to choose your best fit, then select a registration option at the bottom (dates/times/fees are listed in the registration lines). Note: Schedule may adjust due to weather, elections, or building maintenance. Loaner paddles and balls are available. Introductory Pickleball Coaching (Beginner) Brand-new players or those returning after a long break. Learn rules, court layout, scoring, safe movement, grip/stance, and core strokes (serve, return, forehand, backhand). Simple progressions with lots of guided reps in a welcoming setting. Outcome: Comfort with basics and readiness for friendly open play. 2.5 Advanced-Beginner Pickleball Coaching You know the fundamentals and want consistency. Build reliable serve/return, cleaner contact, footwork and positioning, and controlled dinks. Intro to third-shot options and simple doubles communication and rotation. Outcome: Longer rallies and confident participation in social doubles. 3.0 Low-Intermediate Pickleball Coaching Solidify patterns and shot selection. Emphasis on third-shot drop vs. drive, transition footwork to the kitchen, sustained dinking, soft resets, and opportunistic attacking. Scenario-based points with feedback on court coverage and teamwork. Outcome: Execute core patterns reliably and convert more points at the kitchen. 3.5 Intermediate Pickleball Coaching For experienced players aiming to sharpen tactics. Pace control, resets from the mid-court, targeted third shots, reading and countering speed-ups, baiting, stacking/switching, and smarter positioning. High-rep drill blocks plus coached, situational play. Outcome: Higher conversion in fast exchanges and league/tournament play. Drills Pickleball Coaching (All Level) Fast-paced stations to maximize touches: ball-fed sequences, serve/return ladders, third-shot repetitions, transition volleys, hand-speed games, and short coached play. Great add-on for any level to build mechanics and conditioning. Outcome: Sharper mechanics, better stamina, and skills that carry into match play. Coached Round Robin Play (3-Week Session) A fun hybrid of play and instruction! Players rotate through matches while receiving live, on-court coaching. Coaches offer in-game feedback on positioning, shot selection, and tactics during real-time play. Perfect for those ready to test their skills under expert guidance. Outcome: Improved court awareness, smarter decision-making, and confidence in match situations. Who: Adults 17+  • Where: Fairbank Community Center Gym (Side B / Court #3)  • How to Register: Choose your level above, then select your preferred session from the registration options below (dates/times/fees are shown in the registration lines). Town of Acton Recreation Department Register Programs Search Activities Memberships Store Facilities Facility List General Info News Dept Info Contact Contact Us Help How to Register Affiliates Town Site Account Login Create Account Account Login Create Account Register Programs Search Activities Memberships Store Facilities Facility List General Info News Dept Info Contact Contact Us Help How to Register Affiliates Town Site Register Now Skip to nav Adult Pickleball Class Description Introductory Pickleball Class (Beginner) This class is designed for newcomers to pickleball or players with limited experience. It covers the basic fundamentals of the game, including rules, court layout, and scoring. Players will learn how to hold the paddle, proper stance, and basic strokes such as the forehand, backhand, and serve. Emphasis is placed on developing hand-eye coordination, understanding the rules of play, and building confidence. The class is fun, relaxed, and intended to make new players feel comfortable with the game. Novice Pickleball Class This class is for players who have a solid understanding of the basic rules and techniques and are ready to refine their skills. Players will focus on improving consistency, footwork, and positioning. The class will delve into more advanced strokes like the third-shot drop, dinking, and the volley game at the net. There will be an emphasis on strategic play, including understanding when to attack or defend and improving communication with a partner in doubles play. Intermediate Pickleball Class Designed for players with significant experience and who are comfortable with the basic and intermediate techniques of the game. In this class, players will focus on advanced tactics, advanced shot selections, and developing a deeper understanding of strategy. The class will cover complex drills that challenge control, speed, and accuracy, as well as incorporating mental aspects of the game, like anticipation and reading the opponent's moves. Participants will have the opportunity to participate in competitive match play with feedback from the instructor. Return to Programs View All Activities Share This Page:

It covers the basic fundamentals of the game, including rules, court layout, and scoring. Players will learn how to hold the paddle, proper stance, and basic strokes such as the forehand, backhand, and serve. Emphasis is placed on developing hand-eye coordination, understanding the rules of play, and building confidence. The class is fun, relaxed, and intended to make new players feel comfortable with the game. Novice Pickleball Class This class is for players who have a solid understanding of the basic rules and techniques and are ready to refine their skills. Players will focus on improving consistency, footwork, and positioning. The class will delve into more advanced strokes like the third-shot drop, dinking, and the volley game at the net. There will be an emphasis on strategic play, including understanding when to attack or defend and improving communication with a partner in doubles play. Intermediate Pickleball Class Designed for players with significant experience and who are comfortable with the basic and intermediate techniques of the game. In this class, players will focus on advanced tactics, advanced shot selections, and developing a deeper understanding of strategy. The class will cover complex drills that challenge control, speed, and accuracy, as well as incorporating mental aspects of the game, like anticipation and reading the opponent's moves. Participants will have the opportunity to participate in competitive match play with feedback from the instructor. Return to Programs View All Activities Share This Page:

Town of Acton Recreation Department Register Programs Search Activities Memberships Store Facilities Facility List General Info News Dept Info Contact Contact Us Help How to Register Affiliates Town Site Account Login Create Account Account Login Create Account Register Programs Search Activities Memberships Store Facilities Facility List General Info News Dept Info Contact Contact Us Help How to Register Affiliates Town Site Register Now Skip to nav Archery:  On the Mark Archery • Register • View Cart • Unlock the art of precision focus with our inclusive archery classes, suitable for both kids and adults alike. Led by experienced instructors, our program offers a welcoming environment for participants of all ages and skill levels to explore this timeless sport. From mastering the basics of stance and posture to refining aim and accuracy, each session blends expert guidance with hands-on practice, ensuring every archer can progress at their own pace. Whether you're a young enthusiast eager to embark on a new adventure, or an adult seeking a rewarding hobby, this program provides the perfect opportunity to develop confidence, discipline and camaraderie while honing your skill. Archery with On the Mark! (Youths) Learn the Olympic sport of archery and build confidence, self-esteem and focus. Using beautiful wooden recurve bows, this martial art has mental and physical health benefits to help children succeed on and off the range. Weekly lesson plans balance skill with friendly competition. Grades 4 and up Archery with On the Mark! (Adults) Release stress with arrows! Relax after the work day with this low-impact program. Archery is an Olympic sport and is nationally one of the fastest growing.  It is easy to learn, but challenging to master. The thrill of shooting a bow is unlike any other body/mind sensation, involving elements and strategy similar to golf, yoga, martial arts and even chess! Ages 14 and up All equipment provided and class is led by teams of certified USA Archery instructors. Please wear closed-toe footwear and bring a filled water bottle. REFUNDS & WITHDRAWAL S: You may withdraw from a program up to 7 (seven) business days prior to the start date— a non-refundable administrative fee of $25 will be applied to each registration . After that time, no refunds will be issued. Administrative Fees are non-refundable. All requests must be submitted in writing to the Recreation Department requesting cancellation. Refund requests are not accepted through instructors. Refunds by check require several weeks to process. Refunds will not be made for classes missed due to weather. Exception to refund policy timeframe: Written letter from a licensed physician excusing participant from a program prior to first class . Fundamental skills as a foundation for badminton skills and movements as follow. - Proper forehand and backhand grips - Forehand lift - Backhand lift - Clear (high/long) - Serves - Introduction to footwork - Half court practice NO PROGRAM NOVEMBER 11 Students will need a racket and bring non-marking, indoor court shoes. You can get badminton rackets and shoes either from Amazon or Badminton Warehouse. Links to their websites as follow. badmintonwarehouse.com (Any Yonex rackets are good. Norfolk Recreation Register Programs Search Activities Store Facilities Facility List Calendar General Info News Dept Info Contact Contact Us Help How to Register Community Orgs Municipal Site Account Login Create Account Account Login Create Account Register Programs Search Activities Store Facilities Facility List Calendar General Info News Dept Info Contact Contact Us Help How to Register Community Orgs Municipal Site Register Now Skip to nav Adult Exercise with Nanci • Register • View Cart • The Combo Class 1/2-Hour Strength & 1/2-Hour Pilates MONDAYS: 6:30 - 7:30 PM 9/8, 9/15, 9/22, 9/29, 10/6, (NO 10/13), 10/20, 10/27, 11/3, 11/10, 11/17, 11/24, 12/1 WEDNESDAYS 6:30 - 7:30 PM 9/10, 9/17, 9/24, 10/1, 10/8, 10/15, 10/22, 10/29, 11/5, 11/12, 11/19, (NO 11/26), 12/3 FRIDAYS 8:30 - 9:30 AM 9/12, 9/19, 9/26, 10/3, 10/10, 10/17, 10/24, 10/31, 11/7, 11/14, 11/21, (NO 11/28), 12/5 This class has the benefits of both strength training and Pilates! The class consists of a half hour of strength training and a half hour of Pilates. Weights are provided. Please bring a towel or mat. Ladies Light Hike Time: 9:45am - 11:00am Fall Session 1: THURSDAYS: 9/4, 9/11, 9/18, 9/25, 10/2, 10/9 And/Or SATURDAYS: 9/6, 9/13, 9/20, 9/27, 10/4, 10/11 Fall Session 2: THURSDAYS: 10/23, 10/30, 11/6, 11/13, 11/20, (NO 11/27), 12/4 And/Or SATURDAYS: 10/25, 11/1, 11/8, 11/15, 11/22, (NO 11/29), 12/6 Add dimensions to your walking or jogging! Do you like the idea of hiking but don’t want to go alone? Hiking is fantastic exercise as well as a great time to get some fresh air and explore new places. This class moves at a good pace - we’ll be looking for hills! We will meet at various local locations every week (a list will be given distributed). Happy Dogs Hike Time: 10:30 - 11:30 AM Fall Session 1: FRIDAYS:  9/12, 9/19, 9/26, 10/3, 10/10, 10/17 Fall Session 2: FRIDAYS: 10/24, 10/31, 11/7, 11/14, 11/21, (NO 11/28), 12/5 Hike with your “best friend”! Join other dog owners in this popular group exercise! Dogs, just like humans, are social beings. Regular playdates with other dogs are an important part of your dog’s wellbeing. Let’s get together for some fresh air and a romp through the woods with your dog. Bring a leash, pick-up bags and water for your dog. No aggressive dogs please! Locations for Ladies Light Hike & Dog Hike Locations vary each week. The 1st meeting is at F. Gilbert State Forest, 45 Mill Street, Foxborough, MA Park at the Meeting House Chapel. Other locations will be given out at the first meeting . Adult Exercise with Nanci • Register • View Cart • The Combo Class 1/2-Hour Strength & 1/2-Hour Pilates MONDAYS: 6:30 - 7:30 PM 9/8, 9/15, 9/22, 9/29, 10/6, (NO 10/13), 10/20, 10/27, 11/3, 11/10, 11/17, 11/24, 12/1 WEDNESDAYS 6:30 - 7:30 PM 9/10, 9/17, 9/24, 10/1, 10/8, 10/15, 10/22, 10/29, 11/5, 11/12, 11/19, (NO 11/26), 12/3 FRIDAYS 8:30 - 9:30 AM 9/12, 9/19, 9/26, 10/3, 10/10, 10/17, 10/24, 10/31, 11/7, 11/14, 11/21, (NO 11/28), 12/5 This class has the benefits of both strength training and Pilates! The class consists of a half hour of strength training and a half hour of Pilates. Weights are provided. Please bring a towel or mat. Ladies Light Hike Time: 9:45am - 11:00am Fall Session 1: THURSDAYS: 9/4, 9/11, 9/18, 9/25, 10/2, 10/9 And/Or SATURDAYS: 9/6, 9/13, 9/20, 9/27, 10/4, 10/11 Fall Session 2: THURSDAYS: 10/23, 10/30, 11/6, 11/13, 11/20, (NO 11/27), 12/4 And/Or SATURDAYS: 10/25, 11/1, 11/8, 11/15, 11/22, (NO 11/29), 12/6 Add dimensions to your walking or jogging! Do you like the idea of hiking but don’t want to go alone? Hiking is fantastic exercise as well as a great time to get some fresh air and explore new places. This class moves at a good pace - we’ll be looking for hills! We will meet at various local locations every week (a list will be given distributed). Happy Dogs Hike Time: 10:30 - 11:30 AM Fall Session 1: FRIDAYS:  9/12, 9/19, 9/26, 10/3, 10/10, 10/17 Fall Session 2: FRIDAYS: 10/24, 10/31, 11/7, 11/14, 11/21, (NO 11/28), 12/5 Hike with your “best friend”! Join other dog owners in this popular group exercise! Dogs, just like humans, are social beings. Regular playdates with other dogs are an important part of your dog’s wellbeing. Let’s get together for some fresh air and a romp through the woods with your dog. Bring a leash, pick-up bags and water for your dog. No aggressive dogs please! Locations for Ladies Light Hike & Dog Hike Locations vary each week. The 1st meeting is at F. Gilbert State Forest, 45 Mill Street, Foxborough, MA Park at the Meeting House Chapel. Other locations will be given out at the first meeting . Often called a physical game of chess, fencing develops endurance, coordination, agility, poise and balance. While fencing is a physical sport, it is also a mental game requiring concentration, quick decision-making and problem-solving. It’s an ideal activity for people of all ages and sizes. About the Instructor: Michael Tarascio was a member of the United States World Championship Team in Men's Foil. Michael is a Level 4 Foil coach certified through the United States Fencing Association. Also, certified through the Positive Coaching Alliance and the American Sports Education Program. He teaches Recreational Classes for Youth, Teens, and Adults. Michael also teaches Advanced Level Technique and Tactics Classes and provides Individual Coaching for the Serious Competitive Fencer. Michael's philosophy on fencing is: "Participate in fencing because it's fun." Fencing Equipment Purchase and Rental Information will be sent out prior to class. For more information, contact Michael at 978 -210-2711 or michael@nefencing.com . EQUIPMENT POLICY & FENCING GEAR REQUIREMENTS ALL Participants must have fencing equipment to participate. Option 1: Purchasing new Michael recommends Absolute Fencing Gear, Inc. https://www.absolutefencinggear.com/shopping/ Michael is available at michael@nefencing.com to help. Option 2: Rental from Coach Michael $50.00 plus a $100.00 deposit for an 8-week session. At the end of the last class, the deposit will be issued upon returning the fencing gear to Coach Michael.  He will set up appointments for you and your fencer in 15-minute slots for those who need rental fencing gear. Fencers will be fitted for equipment. Fencers will take the equipment home with them. Similar to table tennis, badminton, and tennis, it is a fun, active game that can be mastered by anyone and this program provides a great opportunity to learn how to play pickleball while socializing with others. Instruction and equipment will be provided, along with the opportunity to rest between games. If you have ever wanted to learn more about pickleball or give it a try, this non-competitive program is for you! Doreen Karoll is a PPR-Certified Pickleball Coach and will be facilitating the programs. Please note: This class involves continuous movement on the court and may not be a good fit for individuals with (significant) balance concerns. If you are unsure, we encourage you to consult your physician or contact us to discuss whether this program is right for you. No class on 10/13 & 10/20. Similar to table tennis, badminton, and tennis, it is a fun, active game that can be mastered by anyone. We will be offering separate sessions for Beginners (Mondays), Advanced Beginners (Tuesdays), Intermediate (Fridays), and Advanced (Thursdays) players at the Diamond Middle School. Equipment will be provided and all levels of experience are welcomed . Instruction on the various strokes, serving, and overall game play will be provided during the Beginner session. There will be no instruction during the Advanced Beginner, Intermediate, and Advanced sessions as the format for those sessions will be open play. PK Shiu is a PPR-Certified Pickleball Coach and will be facilitating the program on Monday nights. PK has been coaching players from beginners to 3.5 level in individual and small group settings. He is always looking to introduce more people to play Pickleball, to improve their physical and mental health and make new friends. Due to the popularity of these programs, participants must only register for one session. B e sure to sign-up for the appropriate level class (Beginner - anyone who hasn’t played before, USAPA level 1.0-2.0; Advanced Beginner - USAPA level 2.5-3.0; Intermediate - USAPA level 3.0-3.5; Advanced - USAPA level 3.75+). For more information, go to www.usapa.org/player-skill-rating-definitions . No class on 10/31, 11/11, 11/27, 11/28, 1/19, 1/30, 2/16, 2/17, 2/19, & 2/20. If you would like to add your name to the waitlist, please contact Peter Coleman at pcoleman@lexingtonma.gov . Online Court Reservations in Lexington! The Lexington Recreation and Community Programs Department is excited to continue its partnership with PlayLocal , www.playlocal.com , in 2025! Beginning on February 25 th , Tennis and Pickleball memberships may be purchased online. COURT RESERVATION RULES & GUIDELINES Courts are available for reservations seven days per week, 8:00am-8:00pm from April 1, 2025 – November 23, 2025. There are 10 lighted courts at the Gallagher Courts available for night play with a paid reservation until 9:00pm ( reservations must be made by 12:00pm on the day of the reservation )! Court reservations may be made up to 2 weeks in advance and the PlayLocal system will launch for the 2025 season on Tuesday, March 18th. A person may make only 1 reservation (1 hour/1 court) for any given day. NEW FOR 2025 - courts will go live on PlayLocal on a rolling basis throughout the season, two weeks before the reservation time . For example, if you want to reserve a court at 9:00am on Tuesday, April 15th, you will be able to reserve the court as of Tuesday, April 1st at 9:00am. Similarly, if you want to reserve a court at 5:00pm on Thursday, April 17th, you will be able to reserve the court as of Thursday, April 3rd at 5:00pm. This enhancement will prevent people from having to wake up early at 6:00am to make court reservations, which will make the experience more enjoyable and convenient for court users! Adams #1 and Adams #2, along with Clarke #3, will be reservable for pickleball play only . The Valley Courts will be reconstructed this year and it is anticipated that these courts will be offline from May-August 2025. If you arrive more than 15 minutes late to your reservation, you forfeit use of the court for the entire hour. Once you make a reservation, if you are no longer available at that time, please be sure to cancel your reservation ahead of time. Your consideration for fellow tennis/pickleball players is greatly appreciated. No refunds are given. Rain checks will be issued. Private and semi-private lessons are not allowed on any of the Town courts. The clinics are an instructional program where you will focus on the basic skills of basketball with proper instruction on dribbling, shooting, passing, ball handling techniques, good sportsmanship and teamwork! You will also learn general principles of playing offense and defense, which will be taught and reinforced through instruction, drills, mini games and scrimmages!  I nstruction for the 1st-4th Grade Clinics is provided by Lexington Standout, college coach and facilitator of Pump it Up Basketball, Dan Holbrook and his team. If you are interested in participating in the Smart Start program, please be aware that a parent/caregiver will need to be present for each participant for the duration of the program to assist with skills/drills as needed. Please note, t he Boys 1st & 2nd Grade Clinic and Girls 1st & 2nd Grade Clinic will participate in skills and drills together, scrimmages will be separate. Participants in all programs, except Smart Start will be broken up into teams. 1st - 4th Grade Clinic participants will receive a team jersey and will participate in team scrimmages during each session. Volunteer coaches are needed for the 1st-4th grade clinics. Please indicate in the Q&A section if you are available to assist with the skills/drills as well coaching/substituting the participants during the scrimmage time. No Class on 2/18 for Smart Start and 2/21 for 1st-4th Grade Clinics. The In-Town Basketball League is an organized recreational basketball program for boys and girls currently enrolled in grades 5-12. This season there will be 4 leagues: Girls 5th-8th Grade League Co-ed 5th/6th Grade League Co-ed 7th/8th Grade League Co-ed High School League is a mix of 9th-12th graders There will be a weekly 55 min practice for each team during the week and a 1 hour game on Saturday afternoons. Practice and game times will vary throughout the season and take place at either Clarke or Diamond Middle School. You will receive the specific dates and times of all scheduled practices and games for the league before the season begins. Our leagues utilize the TeamSnap app for scheduling and team communications.  Families will be invited to join the app prior to the start of the season. For the Girls 5th-8th Grade, Co-ed 5th/6th Grade and Co-ed 7th/8th Grade Leagues there will be a Meet and Greet prior to the start of practices/games where players will meet their team mates and coaches.  For the the High School League there will be Draft/Team Formation Night where players will scrimmage and will be selected to teams. Minimal adjustments to player team assignments may be made at the start of the season in an effort to have balanced teams. Meet and Greet and High School Draft dates/times: Tentatively moving to the week of December 15th.  Please visit our website for updates. We will need volunteer coaches for all leagues. You can review our coaching requirements on our website: https://www.lexingtonma.gov/2237/Volunteer-Coaching If you are available and interested, please be sure to check that section off in the Q&A's or reach out to Laura Perry at LPerry@lexingtonma.gov . All of our leagues will hold all participants, volunteers, and spectators accountable to our code of conduct for the program. We will have a ZERO tolerance for behavior unbefitting. If there are any situations that arise during a practice or game, that person will be removed from the program or asked not to spectate during games. No Practice/Games: 1/19, 2/15-2/22. program: Table Tennis for Adults with Lai Wa (Olivia) Lam
details: Recreation & Community Programs | Human Services Department Register Programs Search Activities Memberships Facilities Facility List Calendar Reservation Fees Food Policy General Info News Dept Info Meetings Gallery Team Info Contact Contact Us Help How to Register Affiliates Town Site Account Login Create Account Account Login Create Account Register Programs Search Activities Memberships Facilities Facility List Calendar Reservation Fees Food Policy General Info News Dept Info Meetings Gallery Team Info Contact Contact Us Help How to Register Affiliates Town Site Register Now Skip to nav Table Tennis for Adults with Lai Wa (Olivia) Lam • Register • View Cart • This program is designed for adults and seniors to learn table tennis skills and stay fit. Table tennis helps improve hand-eye coordination, reflexes, and balance. Class starts with 10 minutes of warm-up, followed by practicing racket grips and basic strokes for 30 minutes. The class will end with single/double games. program: Girls Basketball Player Development Program (PDP) Clinics
details: Recreation & Community Programs | Human Services Department Register Programs Search Activities Memberships Facilities Facility List Calendar Reservation Fees Food Policy General Info News Dept Info Meetings Gallery Team Info Contact Contact Us Help How to Register Affiliates Town Site Account Login Create Account Account Login Create Account Register Programs Search Activities Memberships Facilities Facility List Calendar Reservation Fees Food Policy General Info News Dept Info Meetings Gallery Team Info Contact Contact Us Help How to Register Affiliates Town Site Register Now Skip to nav Girls Basketball Player Development Program (PDP) Clinics • Register • View Cart • The Player Development Program (PDP) provides an opportunity for girls to learn more about the game of basketball in a fun, welcoming, and positive environment. Join Coach Adrienne Mugar and other highly skilled coaches for an exciting 6-week clinic designed for girls in grades 1-5. Rookies PDP Clinic - This introductory skills clinic for girls in 1st and 2nd grade focuses on building a strong foundation in basketball fundamentals while sparking excitement for the game. Players will learn basic skills and game concepts in a fun, supportive environment. Gradual introduction to small-sided games and scrimmages allows participants to practice and apply what they've learned in a fun and engaging way. Playmakers PDP Clinic – Designed for girls in grades 3-5, this clinic builds on fundamental skills and introduces more complex concepts of the game. Players will continue developing their technique, decision-making, and court awareness through dynamic drills and small-sides games. The focus is on deepening basketball knowledge, enhancing individual and team play, and fostering confidence in competitive situations. Coach Adrienne is a former professional basketball player, Boston University Women's Basketball captain, and current LHS Girls Varsity Basketball Assistant Coach. She has been coaching youth basketball clinics, camps, and teams for over 16 years. No class on 3/23 & 3/24. Whether your child is picking up a basketball for the first time or preparing for team tryouts, all skill levels are welcome! Our program combines fun drills, structured scrimmages, and friendly competition to build both individual skills and team play. We emphasize respect, teamwork, and a positive attitude throughout. Each session includes personalized feedback and tips to help each child grow and improve. Program Eligibility Requirements: - participants must have the desire to participate in sessions and have an interest in basketball - participants must be able to follow familiar one to two step directions No class on 11/27. Pump It Up Basketball • Register • View Cart • Under the direction of Lexington standout and college coach Dan Holbrook and former Bentley University and professional player Dan O’Keefe, Pump It Up Basketball is designed for children ages 6-12 who want to learn and have fun. Whether your child is picking up a basketball for the first time or preparing for team tryouts, all skill levels are welcome! Our program combines fun drills, structured scrimmages, and friendly competition to build both individual skills and team play. We emphasize respect, teamwork, and a positive attitude throughout. Each session includes personalized feedback and tips to help each child grow and improve. Program Eligibility Requirements: - participants must have the desire to participate in sessions and have an interest in basketball - participants must be able to follow familiar one to two step directions No class on 11/27. This session will include instruction on four fundamentals of volleyball: passing, setting, hitting, and serving. Players are welcome to bring their own volleyball if they would like, but it is not required. Come and play like a champion! Join Super Soccer Stars for some soccer fun this winter! At Super Soccer Stars, it is their goal to teach soccer skills in a fun, non-competitive, educational environment. Their philosophy is to use soccer to nurture, to build self-confidence, and to develop teamwork in every class. Their specially designed curricula use positive reinforcement and a low child-to-coach ratio to ensure that each child improves at his or her own rate while having endless fun. Super Soccer Stars will be offering a variety of programs on Saturdays this winter for children ages 1-7. No class on 2/14. Join On the Mark Archery and learn the martial art of archery using beautiful wooden recurve bows to focus more on the form and technique rather than just the aiming. Build character, self-esteem and confidence with each triumph and tribulation on the range as you work hard to achieve consistent success! Unique lesson plans implement skill building drills with unique games that include prizes to keep students engaged throughout the program. All equipment provided and class is led by teams of certified USA Archery instructors. Archery for Adults! Release stress with arrows! Relax and unwind after a long day at work and sign up for a low-impact fitness course like Archery. This unique Olympic sport is one of the fastest growing across America and is easy to learn, but difficult to master. The thrill of shooting a bow is unlike any other body mind experience and it involves form elements and strategy similar to golf, yoga, martial arts and even chess! All equipment is provided and this course is led by certified USA Archery instructors. Players will learn proper techniques for dinking, serving, and returning, with an emphasis on consistency and control. Through fun drills and guided practice, beginners will build confidence and develop essential skills for game play. No prior experience is necessary, just bring a positive attitude and a desire to learn! Sportsmanship is paramount at our tournament.  The tournament is held at the Newton South High School and uses 2 gyms for tournament play.  Both gyms are hardwood floor basketball courts and lined with green tape.  Additional warm up courts are available on a rubberized surface. Our tournament offers divisions for B, C and now D level players, and beginner and intermediate youth.  Be sure to register for the appropriate division for your level of play.  Please understand that A level players and advanced youth are not allowed in our tournament, but are welcome to come and watch. Ages are determined by calendar year, so your age for the tournament is the age you will be on December 31, 2026. Please Note: Because of time constraints we limit the number of divisions that a person can register for. B, C & D level players may register for 1 single and 1 double division on Saturday and 1 mixed double division on Sunday.  Youth ages14 and older (born 2012 or earlier) may play in the Open or Youth division, but not both.  Youth division players may sign up for 1 single and 1 double division on Sunday. This year’s tournament will have single elimination and round robin games.  Single elimination games will play best of 3 games to 21 points. Round robin games will play best of 3 games to 15 points and play each team in their bracket. Consolation games for single elimination divisions will play 1 game to 31 points.  Please see the Tournament Flyer for more details Registration Information: Everyone playing in the tournament must register online and sign the waiver. Divisions are limited so register early to guarantee your space.  Registration closes February 27th or when the division is full.  Refunds will only be issued if we can fill the space.  Be sure to register for the appropriate division.  Players registered for the incorrect division will be moved to the appropriate division if space allows, or will have their entries cancelled. * For singles divisions, each person playing must register for their division. * For doubles divisions, one team member will register for the division, list their team member, and pay the fee.  The other team member will need to register in the doubles partners sign up for the appropriate day to fill out their information and sign the waiver. * It is ok for a lower level player to play "up" in a division, but higher level players can not play down a level.  For example, in doubles, a C or D level player may play up in the B doubles division with a B level partner, but the B level player can not play down in the C or D doubles (with the exception of the B/C mixed doubles which is meant for this situation).  Please choose your partners accordingly. * Register early as divisions have filled in previous years. * Any changes to partners must be approved prior to the start of the tournament. Youth Divisions: The youth single age groups and youth double beginner division are meant for players in their first couple of years of playing and competing in badminton tournaments.  If youth are more advanced than peers in their age group, have several years of consistent experience, have attended several competitions or are ranked, have won our tournament in previous years, or are ready for more of a challenge, they should play in the intermediate division. We do not have an advanced youth division, but if youth are 14 or older they can play in the open division in the B or C level.  Age eligible youth may not compete in both the youth and open division, they must pick one or the other. Round robin games will play best of 3 games to 15 points and play each team in their bracket. Consolation games for single elimination divisions will play 1 game to 31 points.  Please see the Tournament Flyer for more details Registration Information: Everyone playing in the tournament must register online and sign the waiver. Divisions are limited so register early to guarantee your space.  Registration closes February 27th or when the division is full.  Refunds will only be issued if we can fill the space.  Be sure to register for the appropriate division.  Players registered for the incorrect division will be moved to the appropriate division if space allows, or will have their entries cancelled. * For singles divisions, each person playing must register for their division. * For doubles divisions, one team member will register for the division, list their team member, and pay the fee.  The other team member will need to register in the doubles partners sign up for the appropriate day to fill out their information and sign the waiver. * It is ok for a lower level player to play "up" in a division, but higher level players can not play down a level.  For example, in doubles, a C or D level player may play up in the B doubles division with a B level partner, but the B level player can not play down in the C or D doubles (with the exception of the B/C mixed doubles which is meant for this situation).  Please choose your partners accordingly. * Register early as divisions have filled in previous years. * Any changes to partners must be approved prior to the start of the tournament. Youth Divisions: The youth single age groups and youth double beginner division are meant for players in their first couple of years of playing and competing in badminton tournaments.  If youth are more advanced than peers in their age group, have several years of consistent experience, have attended several competitions or are ranked, have won our tournament in previous years, or are ready for more of a challenge, they should play in the intermediate division. We do not have an advanced youth division, but if youth are 14 or older they can play in the open division in the B or C level.  Age eligible youth may not compete in both the youth and open division, they must pick one or the other. Build character, self-esteem and confidence with each triumph and tribulation on the range as you work hard to achieve consistent success! Unique lesson plans implement skill building drills with games that include prizes to keep students engaged throughout the program. All equipment is provided and class is led by teams of certified USA Archery instructors. Register on your own, or sign up with friends or family.  Each session is 4 weeks.  Sign up for one or multiple sessions to improve your skills. Be sure to click on the link to fill out the Archery Program Waiver after you register.  This will give instructors information about your height, dominant hand, etc. so they can bring the correct bows. Classes at Cabot School run in the Fall and Spring on Saturdays and include 3 full sized hard wood floor courts. Classes at Newton South Recreation Complex run in the Winter on Sundays in the field house and use 3 hardwood floor courts and 1 rubber court. Youth classes are open to all level players.  Multiple courts allow instructors to work with different skill levels on separate courts. Classes for Teens and Adults include a Beginner/Intermediate section and an Intermediate/Advanced section.  As with our youth classes, multiple courts allow instructors to work with different skill levels on separate courts. * Beginner/Intermediate players are new to the sport, like to play recreationally, or are still developing their footwork, strokes and accuracy of their shots. * Intermediate/Advanced players should have a solid foundation on different strokes and movement around the court and be serious about improving their game. Each time slot is opened to 6 participants and is $9.00 Age group 21 and up Mon, Tue & Wed Time Slot One: 9:00- 10:30 A.M Time Slot Two: 10:30- 12:00 P.M Saturday - 11:00 - 12:30pm Please contact Stephanie 617-796-1528 with questions. ------------------------------------------------------------------------- Lower Falls Community Center 9 Week program- Fridays 9:30- 11:00 a.m. December & January intermediate Skills Rating Defined Here This is not a drop in program. You must be pre-paid and pre-registered to play. THERE ARE NO REFUNDS OR CREDITS.  We will offer make ups for time lost to weather events. Punch cards are not accepted at this program. Newton Parks, Recreation and Culture Register Programs Search Activities Memberships Store Events Facilities Facility List Calendar General Info News Dept Info Meetings Team Info Contact Contact Us Help How to Register Affiliates Municipal Site Account Login Create Account Account Login Create Account Register Programs Search Activities Memberships Store Events Facilities Facility List Calendar General Info News Dept Info Meetings Team Info Contact Contact Us Help How to Register Affiliates Municipal Site Register Now Skip to nav 2026 Badminton Tournament - March 14 & 15, 2026 • Register • View Cart • This tournament is hosted by Newton Parks and Recreation and promotes a love for the sport of badminton. Sportsmanship is paramount at our tournament.  The tournament is held at the Newton South High School and uses 2 gyms for tournament play.  Both gyms are hardwood floor basketball courts and lined with green tape.  Additional warm up courts are available on a rubberized surface. Our tournament offers divisions for B, C and now D level players, and beginner and intermediate youth.  Be sure to register for the appropriate division for your level of play.  Please understand that A level players and advanced youth are not allowed in our tournament, but are welcome to come and watch. Ages are determined by calendar year, so your age for the tournament is the age you will be on December 31, 2026. Please Note: Because of time constraints we limit the number of divisions that a person can register for. B, C & D level players may register for 1 single and 1 double division on Saturday and 1 mixed double division on Sunday.  Youth ages14 and older (born 2012 or earlier) may play in the Open or Youth division, but not both.  Youth division players may sign up for 1 single and 1 double division on Sunday. This year’s tournament will have single elimination and round robin games.  Single elimination games will play best of 3 games to 21 points. Round robin games will play best of 3 games to 15 points and play each team in their bracket. Consolation games for single elimination divisions will play 1 game to 31 points.  Please see the Tournament Flyer for more details Registration Information: Everyone playing in the tournament must register online and sign the waiver. Divisions are limited so register early to guarantee your space.  Registration closes February 27th or when the division is full.  Refunds will only be issued if we can fill the space.  Be sure to register for the appropriate division.  Players registered for the incorrect division will be moved to the appropriate division if space allows, or will have their entries cancelled. * For singles divisions, each person playing must register for their division. * For doubles divisions, one team member will register for the division, list their team member, and pay the fee.  The other team member will need to register in the doubles partners sign up for the appropriate day to fill out their information and sign the waiver. * It is ok for a lower level player to play "up" in a division, but higher level players can not play down a level.  For example, in doubles, a C or D level player may play up in the B doubles division with a B level partner, but the B level player can not play down in the C or D doubles (with the exception of the B/C mixed doubles which is meant for this situation).  Please choose your partners accordingly. * Register early as divisions have filled in previous years. * Any changes to partners must be approved prior to the start of the tournament. Youth Divisions: The youth single age groups and youth double beginner division are meant for players in their first couple of years of playing and competing in badminton tournaments.  If youth are more advanced than peers in their age group, have several years of consistent experience, have attended several competitions or are ranked, have won our tournament in previous years, or are ready for more of a challenge, they should play in the intermediate division. We do not have an advanced youth division, but if youth are 14 or older they can play in the open division in the B or C level.  Age eligible youth may not compete in both the youth and open division, they must pick one or the other. 2026 Badminton Tournament - March 14 & 15, 2026 • Register • View Cart • This tournament is hosted by Newton Parks and Recreation and promotes a love for the sport of badminton. Sportsmanship is paramount at our tournament.  The tournament is held at the Newton South High School and uses 2 gyms for tournament play.  Both gyms are hardwood floor basketball courts and lined with green tape.  Additional warm up courts are available on a rubberized surface. Our tournament offers divisions for B, C and now D level players, and beginner and intermediate youth.  Be sure to register for the appropriate division for your level of play.  Please understand that A level players and advanced youth are not allowed in our tournament, but are welcome to come and watch. Ages are determined by calendar year, so your age for the tournament is the age you will be on December 31, 2026. Please Note: Because of time constraints we limit the number of divisions that a person can register for. B, C & D level players may register for 1 single and 1 double division on Saturday and 1 mixed double division on Sunday.  Youth ages14 and older (born 2012 or earlier) may play in the Open or Youth division, but not both.  Youth division players may sign up for 1 single and 1 double division on Sunday. This year’s tournament will have single elimination and round robin games.  Single elimination games will play best of 3 games to 21 points. Round robin games will play best of 3 games to 15 points and play each team in their bracket. Consolation games for single elimination divisions will play 1 game to 31 points.  Please see the Tournament Flyer for more details Registration Information: Everyone playing in the tournament must register online and sign the waiver. Divisions are limited so register early to guarantee your space.  Registration closes February 27th or when the division is full.  Refunds will only be issued if we can fill the space.  Be sure to register for the appropriate division.  Players registered for the incorrect division will be moved to the appropriate division if space allows, or will have their entries cancelled. * For singles divisions, each person playing must register for their division. * For doubles divisions, one team member will register for the division, list their team member, and pay the fee.  The other team member will need to register in the doubles partners sign up for the appropriate day to fill out their information and sign the waiver. * It is ok for a lower level player to play "up" in a division, but higher level players can not play down a level.  For example, in doubles, a C or D level player may play up in the B doubles division with a B level partner, but the B level player can not play down in the C or D doubles (with the exception of the B/C mixed doubles which is meant for this situation).  Please choose your partners accordingly. * Register early as divisions have filled in previous years. * Any changes to partners must be approved prior to the start of the tournament. Youth Divisions: The youth single age groups and youth double beginner division are meant for players in their first couple of years of playing and competing in badminton tournaments.  If youth are more advanced than peers in their age group, have several years of consistent experience, have attended several competitions or are ranked, have won our tournament in previous years, or are ready for more of a challenge, they should play in the intermediate division. We do not have an advanced youth division, but if youth are 14 or older they can play in the open division in the B or C level.  Age eligible youth may not compete in both the youth and open division, they must pick one or the other. Build character, self-esteem and confidence with each triumph and tribulation on the range as you work hard to achieve consistent success! Unique lesson plans implement skill building drills with games that include prizes to keep students engaged throughout the program. All equipment is provided and class is led by teams of certified USA Archery instructors. Register on your own, or sign up with friends or family.  Each session is 4 weeks.  Sign up for one or multiple sessions to improve your skills. Be sure to click on the link to fill out the Archery Program Waiver after you register.  This will give instructors information about your height, dominant hand, etc. so they can bring the correct bows. Classes at Cabot School run in the Fall and Spring on Saturdays and include 3 full sized hard wood floor courts. Classes at Newton South Recreation Complex run in the Winter on Sundays in the field house and use 3 hardwood floor courts and 1 rubber court. Youth classes are open to all level players.  Multiple courts allow instructors to work with different skill levels on separate courts. Classes for Teens and Adults include a Beginner/Intermediate section and an Intermediate/Advanced section.  As with our youth classes, multiple courts allow instructors to work with different skill levels on separate courts. * Beginner/Intermediate players are new to the sport, like to play recreationally, or are still developing their footwork, strokes and accuracy of their shots. * Intermediate/Advanced players should have a solid foundation on different strokes and movement around the court and be serious about improving their game. Badminton Instruction • Register • View Cart • Learn the skills of badminton including grip, stroke development, movement around the court, singles and doubles play, and physical training to support skills.  Classes include instruction and round robin style play to practice skills. Classes at Cabot School run in the Fall and Spring on Saturdays and include 3 full sized hard wood floor courts. Classes at Newton South Recreation Complex run in the Winter on Sundays in the field house and use 3 hardwood floor courts and 1 rubber court. Youth classes are open to all level players.  Multiple courts allow instructors to work with different skill levels on separate courts. Classes for Teens and Adults include a Beginner/Intermediate section and an Intermediate/Advanced section.  As with our youth classes, multiple courts allow instructors to work with different skill levels on separate courts. * Beginner/Intermediate players are new to the sport, like to play recreationally, or are still developing their footwork, strokes and accuracy of their shots. * Intermediate/Advanced players should have a solid foundation on different strokes and movement around the court and be serious about improving their game. program: Winter Indoor Tennis at Newton South
details: Newton Parks, Recreation and Culture Register Programs Search Activities Memberships Store Events Facilities Facility List Calendar General Info News Dept Info Meetings Team Info Contact Contact Us Help How to Register Affiliates Municipal Site Account Login Create Account Account Login Create Account Register Programs Search Activities Memberships Store Events Facilities Facility List Calendar General Info News Dept Info Meetings Team Info Contact Contact Us Help How to Register Affiliates Municipal Site Register Now Skip to nav Winter Indoor Tennis at Newton South • Register • View Cart • Join us for indoor tennis this Winter with JXS Tennis Academy.  All players need to bring their own racket and bottle of water.  Please bring a clean, dry pair of sneakers for the gym.  If it is raining or snowy outside this may mean bringing a separate pair of sneakers to change into. Because of the scheduling of classes and limited time availability, make-ups are not offered for this program if you need to miss a class. What do the ball colors mean? Red Ball: 19/21-inch rackets are used with red felt balls.  This means children can control the ball and racket, develop proper swing technique and get a real sense of playing the game. Orange Ball: 21/23-inch rackets are used with an orange ball that is lower compression that travels a little faster and farther than the red ball.  Players are taught proper technique for all strokes-focusing on ground stroke development, net play and serving. Footwork and beginning level of basic strategy – how to keep score and rally. Green Ball: 25/27 inch rackets are used.  The green ball has less pressure than the standard yellow ball (75% pressure) and easier to hit.  This stage is for players that can rally, volley and beginning to understand strategy and tactics. Yellow Ball: Is designed for high school and adult competitive players.  Designed for players that have the ability and strength to use a standard size tennis ball. Newton Parks, Recreation and Culture Register Programs Search Activities Memberships Store Events Facilities Facility List Calendar General Info News Dept Info Meetings Team Info Contact Contact Us Help How to Register Affiliates Municipal Site Account Login Create Account Account Login Create Account Register Programs Search Activities Memberships Store Events Facilities Facility List Calendar General Info News Dept Info Meetings Team Info Contact Contact Us Help How to Register Affiliates Municipal Site Register Now Skip to nav Pickleball Lessons - (Pellegrini) Hawthorn • Register • View Cart • Level 1: New to the game/beginners Lesson: For players who have played very little or not at all. You will learn about the rules, how to keep score, serving, volleys, serves & return of serve. 30 minutes of each session you will have match play and critiqued, helpful suggestions will be given to play the game. Level 2 Low/beyond beginners Lesson: (2.0 Level). Players looking to learn and improve serving (classic and new styles), Learn proper volleys, serves & return of Serve. We will break them down into easy to learn steps for you to grasp them. 30 minutes of each session you will have match play and critiqued, helpful suggestions will be given to improve your game. Level 2B : Intermediate Lesson: (2.5-2.75 Level). Players looking to improve serving and placing the ball. Improve volleys, serves & return of Serve. We will break down the mechanics into easy steps for you to be consistent. 30 minutes of each session you will have match play and critiqued, helpful suggestions will be given to improve your game. Level 3: Gets most of serves “in” Able to serve and return serve deep consistently. Hits to the weak side of opponent often. Work on more strategies of playing during games. 30 minutes of each session you will have match play and critiqued, helpful suggestions will be given to improve your game The lessons are packaged in groups of two lessons, on two different dates, for $50.00 Ratio: Four Students to One Teacher Weather Cancellation Policy: Lesson will be refunded.  We do not reschedule canceled lessons due to weather. Waiting for Pickleball lessons?  Email Stephanie slapham@newtonma.gov to have your email added to our Pickleball lesson distribution list.  As soon as lessons are posted you will be emailed. program: Winter Indoor Tennis at Newton South
details: Newton Parks, Recreation and Culture Register Programs Search Activities Memberships Store Events Facilities Facility List Calendar General Info News Dept Info Meetings Team Info Contact Contact Us Help How to Register Affiliates Municipal Site Account Login Create Account Account Login Create Account Register Programs Search Activities Memberships Store Events Facilities Facility List Calendar General Info News Dept Info Meetings Team Info Contact Contact Us Help How to Register Affiliates Municipal Site Register Now Skip to nav Winter Indoor Tennis at Newton South • Register • View Cart • Join us for indoor tennis this Winter with JXS Tennis Academy.  All players need to bring their own racket and bottle of water.  Please bring a clean, dry pair of sneakers for the gym.  If it is raining or snowy outside this may mean bringing a separate pair of sneakers to change into. Because of the scheduling of classes and limited time availability, make-ups are not offered for this program if you need to miss a class. What do the ball colors mean? Red Ball: 19/21-inch rackets are used with red felt balls.  This means children can control the ball and racket, develop proper swing technique and get a real sense of playing the game. Orange Ball: 21/23-inch rackets are used with an orange ball that is lower compression that travels a little faster and farther than the red ball.  Players are taught proper technique for all strokes-focusing on ground stroke development, net play and serving. Footwork and beginning level of basic strategy – how to keep score and rally. Green Ball: 25/27 inch rackets are used.  The green ball has less pressure than the standard yellow ball (75% pressure) and easier to hit.  This stage is for players that can rally, volley and beginning to understand strategy and tactics. Yellow Ball: Is designed for high school and adult competitive players.  Designed for players that have the ability and strength to use a standard size tennis ball. Newton Parks, Recreation and Culture Register Programs Search Activities Memberships Store Events Facilities Facility List Calendar General Info News Dept Info Meetings Team Info Contact Contact Us Help How to Register Affiliates Municipal Site Account Login Create Account Account Login Create Account Register Programs Search Activities Memberships Store Events Facilities Facility List Calendar General Info News Dept Info Meetings Team Info Contact Contact Us Help How to Register Affiliates Municipal Site Register Now Skip to nav Strength Building Class- Active Adult • Register • View Cart • Grow strong and stay strong! This muscle conditioning class will focus on improving upper and lower body muscular strength.  Our instructor Cam Bergeron  has a B.S in Exercise Physiology, and is certified in Strength and Conditioning,  Burdenko Physical Therapy and Functional Fitness. What people are saying about this class! You might be interested to learn that both physical therapists I saw last Friday at the hospital, and yesterday at home, were quite impressed with my general level of flexibility and muscle tone, which I attribute to the weights class (and swimnastics). STOP AND READ Please note that a Zoom link is not generated when you sign up for a class using Myrec. In order to have the best possible experience, we have created a Zoom Link Policy. Zoom links are email to current participants two weeks before the start of class.  We follow a policy of a sign-up deadline, email the Zoom link and then check to make sure everyone has received it. New students are encouraged to sign up at anytime during the session, however it is best to call so we can pro-rate the class and send the link.  New students are always welcome to try the first class for free. Whether you are brand new to yoga or have a regular practice, join us to stretch, strengthen, meditate, learn, explore, breath, play,relax, rejoice and renew every Friday on your mat with Barbara Perlo. Barbara has been teaching yoga throughout the Boston area for a decade and is known for sharing yoga in a playful, exploratory and relaxing manner. You will be taught traditional asanas and offered modifications along the way. We will link asanas as we flex and extend both our brains and bodies. WARNING! This class is taught in a judgment free zone, you may enjoy this workout, this practice is addictive.  Barbara has been told she has a healthy laugh! STOP AND READ Please note that a Zoom link is not generated when you sign up for a class using Myrec. In order to have the best possible experience, we have created a Zoom Link Policy. Zoom links are email to current participants two weeks before the start of class.  We follow a policy of a sign-up deadline, email the Zoom link and then check to make sure everyone has received it. New students are encouraged to sign up at anytime during the session, however it is best to call so we can pro-rate the class and send the link.  New students are always welcome to try the first class for free. Please call 617-796-1506 Register Activity Ages Grades Days Date/Time Fees Log In Adult  Mat Yoga Class  Oct-Nov-Dec 45y - 100y N/A F 10/31/2025 - 12/19/2025 09:00 AM - 10:00 AM zoom $100.00 Res, $100.00 Non-Res 5 seat(s) available * Adjustments and discounts will be applied during checkout if applicable. * Return to Programs View All Activities Share This Page:

Players must pre-register for either the full session or individual weeks.  Online registration is required - no drop ins allowed.  Pickleball punch cards are not valid for this program.  Space is limited so register early. Only registered participants will be allowed to sign in.  Please do not arrive early.  Players will be allowed in 15 minutes before their program start time. At Newton North - courts are on a hard rubber surface.  3 courts will be reserved for beginners, and 3 for intermediate/advanced players.
